peopleAlsoAsk.question: How do I find out what my artwork is worth?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Appraisals & Appraisers Consider finding an appraiser to determine the value of your artwork. Appraisers are trained specialists who work for a fee. They evaluate your piece and give you a written statement of its value.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: How Much Is Your Object Worth? | Smithsonian American Art Museum

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How much does it cost to get art valued?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: How much does it cost? The certificate of valuation costs $250 (including GST) for the first artwork, with each additional original painting valued at $125. If you purchased the “Hart” artwork originally from David Hart Galleries, then the cost of the valuations are reduced to $125 each.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Hart Art Valuations & Appraisals - David Hart Galleries

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How do I get my artwork valued?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: If the name is not clear you may need to use a professional dealer or auction house to attribute the artwork. If you suspect that your picture is valuable, take it to a specialist fine art auctioneer, such as Bonham's, Christie's or Sotheby's. Bonham's has offices in cities around the UK.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: How can I value my print or picture? - the Fine Art Trade Guild

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How do you find the value of a piece of art?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet:
By taking into account its historical, aesthetic, and social context, you can determine a fair and equitable price for the artwork that reflects its true worth. Art valuation involves a deep appreciation for the cultural significance of art, as well as the economic and commercial forces that shape the art market.
Feb 5, 2025
